As well, you could just use Ant to do it... :)

    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: Di Iorio, Matthew (ISS Atlanta) [mailto:mdiiorio@...]
    > Sent: Wednesday, October 03, 2001 4:06 PM
    > To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
    > Subject: RE: [junit] ClassPathTestCollector
    > 
    > 
    > TestFinderSuite is a TestSuite that does the same thing:
    > 
    > http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=4
    > 20299&group_id=152
    > 78&atid=315278
    > 
    > Source code:
    > 
    > http://sourceforge.net/tracker/download.php?group_id=15278
    > &atid=315278&file_
    > id=8476&aid=420299
    > 
    > ClassFinder is the class that compiles a list of classes 
    > on the classpath.
    > 
    > Matt
    > 
    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: Matt Munz [mailto:mattmunz@...]
    > Sent: Wednesday, October 03, 2001 4:06 PM
    > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    > Subject: [junit] ClassPathTestCollector
    > 
    > 
    > Hi all.
    > 
    >   I'm working on a TestRunner that sweeps up all of the 
    > TestCases on the
    > class path into one TestSuite and then runs it, dumping 
    > the results
    > optionally to a file, System.out, or a gui.  This 
    > TestRunner could then be
    > used in automation and during development with a minimum of setup.
    >   ClassPathTestCollector does a great job of grabbing up 
    > the .class files on
    > the class path, but it doesn't dip into the jars to grab 
    > those classes also.
    > I'm about to write some code to add this functionality.  
    > Has anyone already
    > done this?  If so, could you share code, ideas, or suggestions?
    >   Thanks.
    > 
    >   - Matt Munz
    >     mmunz@... (please cc: responses to this address)
    > 
    >

    > junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
